newsitem.title: USA: Oregon unemployment rate rises to 5.4 pct in Aug.
newsitem.headline: Oregon unemployment rate rises to 5.4 pct in Aug.

text.p: Oregon's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate rose one-tenth of a percentage point to 5.4 percent in August, according to the Oregon Employment Department.

The rate is the highest Oregon's economy has experienced since June 1994, when the rate was also 5.4 percent. In comparison, the January 1995 and March 1995 rates, both at 4.6 percent, were Oregon's lowest figures in 25 years.
"Oregon's unemployment rate, at 5.4 percent in August, is still quite low, despite its rise over the past six months," said David Cooke, an economist with the Employment Department.
"Most sectors of the economy and many regions of the state are experiencing rapid economic expansion and strong job growth," Cooke added.
The Employment Department's monthly survey of businesses showed that 9,200 jobs were added in August.
